description: Full planning permission for landscaping amendments, alterations to footpaths, replacement of the existing children's play facilities, installation of seating and trim trail equipment, public realm alterations, erection of fencing and works to trees. (Council's own application)

open_spaces_details.description: Alton Activity Centre play space increasing from 2,100sqm to 2,291sqm (excluding the building)
open_spaces_details.open_space_type: Provision for children and young people

decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.

Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed: Arboricultural Impact Assessment (March 2024) by Tim Moya Associates; Archaeological Desk-Based Assessment (March 2024) by RPS Group; Biodiversity net gain design stage report (June 2024); Covering letter (March 2024) by Stantec; Design and Access Statement (March 2024) by Spacehub; Fire Statement (March 2024) by Spacehub; Flood Risk Assessment and Drainage Strategy (March 2024) by Campbell Reith; Geotechnical and Geo-environmental Preliminary Risk Assessment (March 2024) by Campbell Reith; Heritage Statement (March 2024) by Built Heritage Consultancy; Outline Construction Logistics Plan (March 2024) by Arup; Planning Statement (March 2024) by Stantec; Preliminary Ecological Appraisal (March 2024) by PJC; Statement of Community Involvement (March 2024) by Raven Communications; Sustainability Statement (March 2024) by Spacehub; 8427-PL-GA-001 Site location plan; 8427-PL-GA-002 Existing Downshire Field plan; 8427-PL-GA-003 Existing DF Play Space Plan; 8427-PL-GA-004 Existing AAC Play Space Plan; 8427-PL-GA-101 Downshire Field Plan; 8427-PL-GA-102 Downshire Field Play Space Plan; 8427-PL-GA-103 Alton Activity Centre Play Space Plan; Applicant's response to post-submission comments (5 June 2024) by Stantec; Applicant's response to post-submission comments (11 June 2024) by Stantec.
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.

Condition : 3 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the Preliminary Risk Assessment (Desk Study) carried out by Campbell Reith dated March 2024.
If, during development, contamination not previously identified is found to be present at the site then no further development (unless otherwise agreed in writing with the local planning authority) shall be carried out until the developer has submitted and obtained written approval from the local planning authority for a remediation strategy detailing how this unsuspected contamination shall be dealt with. The remediation strategy shall be implemented as approved, verified and reported to the satisfaction of the local planning authority. 
Reason: To ensure that risks from land contamination to the future users of the land and neighbouring land are minimised, together with those to controlled waters, property and ecological systems, and to ensure that the development can be carried out safely without unacceptable risks to workers, neighbours and other off-site receptors, having regard to adopted policies LP2 and LP14 of the Wandsworth Local Plan Core Strategy policy IS4 and DMPD policy DMH4, coupled with the requirements of the NPPF. The details are required prior to the start of the works so that the necessary precautions and mitigation measures can be incorporated into the excavation and construction.

Condition : 4 - No demolition or development shall take place until a written scheme of investigation (WSI) has been submitted to and approved by the local planning authority in writing. For land that is included within the WSI, no demolition or development shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed WSI, which shall include the statement of significance and research objectives, and
a)	The programme and methodology of site investigation and recording and the nomination of a competent person(s) or organisation to undertake the agreed works.
b)	Where appropriate, details of a programme for delivering related positive public benefits. 
c)	The programme for post-investigation assessment and subsequent analysis, publication and dissemination and deposition of resulting material. This part of the condition shall not be discharged until these elements have been fulfilled in accordance with the programme set out in the WSI.
The development shall then be carried out in accordance with these approved details.
Reason: In order to safeguard the archaeological interests on the site, in accordance with paragraph 211 of the National Planning Policy Framework. The approval of the WSI before works begin on site provide clarity on what investigations are required and their timing in relation to the development programme.

Condition : 7 - Prior to commencement of the relevant part of the development a detailed landscaping scheme, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. These details shall include hard landscaping works including surfacing, soft landscaping, the species, size and height of trees and root volumes, shrubs, and hedges, relating to:
a)	Downshire Field including the Bull Sculpture; 
b)	Downshire Field play space; and
c)	The Alton Activity Centre.
When seeking to satisfy this condition, priority will be given to native and wildlife friendly species, including night scented species; minor artefacts and structures (e.g. furniture equipment, refuse or other storage units, ecologically sensitive lighting (in accordance with the Bat Conservation Trust and ILP 2023 Guidance); proposed and existing functional services above and below ground (e.g. drainage power; communications cables, pipelines, indicating lines, manholes, supports). Any trees or plants planted as part of the approved landscape scheme for each play area which within a period of five years from when the trees or plants are planted are found to be dead, removed, or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season with others of similar size and species, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.
The proposed surface treatment materials must have regard to the consultation response provided by London Parks and Gardens dated 11 June 2024.
The landscaping scheme shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and completed prior to the use of the corresponding play areas to which the landscaping relates at Downshire Field and the Alton Activity Centre. The landscaping shall be managed and maintained in accordance with the approved scheme thereafter unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: In the interest of design quality and biodiversity, in accordance with the NPPF, London Plan po

Condition : 8 - Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans and set out in the supporting information, Landscape and Ecological Enhancement and Management Plans shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of any relevant above ground works. The Plan shall include details of all measures to provide biodiversity gain onsite and offsite, including but not limited to: 
a)	details of native and wildlife friendly planting, including mixed native species hedging, neutral grassland and night scented species. The species list should indicate which species are native and what the wildlife value is; 
b)	details of biodiversity features including log piles, stumpery, sand piles, stone piles, bird and bat boxes and invertebrate habitats;
c)	a bat sensitive post-construction lighting plan, including lux spill diagrams, to ensure that any lighting will be of a specification that minimises its impacts on bats, onsite habitats and the adjacent Wimbledon Common and Putney Heath SINC in accordance with the BCT and ILP 2023 Guidance Note (including having a colour temperature of <2700k and no uplighters). 
d)	details on the management to be implemented post-construction shall also be submitted, which shall include management responsibilities and maintenance schedules for all hard and soft landscaped areas as well as the above-mentioned measures to provide biodiversity gain. 
The approved details shall be implemented prior to first use of the play areas at Downshire Field and the Alton Activity Centre and shall be maintained thereafter.
Reason: In the interest of ensuring there is no net loss of habitats, no harm to species populations and to ensure the provision of biodiversity gain in accordance with the NPPF, London Plan policies G6 and G7 and policies LP55 and LP56 of the Wandsworth Local Plan.

Condition : 9 - Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans and set out in the supporting information, details of all Biodiversity Net Gain shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of development. Details shall include:
a)	Completed Biodiversity Net Gain Plan
b)	Completed statutory metric with the Pre-development and post-development biodiversity values.
The development shall then be carried out in accordance with these approved details.
Reason: In the interest of ensuring there is no net loss of habitats, no harm to species populations and to ensure the provision of biodiversity gain in accordance with the NPPF, London Plan policy G6 and policy LP55 of the Wandsworth Local Plan.

Condition : 11 - Arboricultural method statement
Prior to the commencement of development in Downshire Field and on the site of the Alton Activity Centre, a detailed Arboricultural Method Statement (as referred to in the Arboricultural Statement produced by Tim Moya and Associates and dated March 2024), shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. The development shall then be undertaken in accordance with the approved detailed Arboricultural Statement and the tree shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the approved layout unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. 
Reason: In the interest of design quality and visual amenity and to minimise the impact on heritage assets in accordance with policy G7 of the London Plan and policy LP56 of the Wandsworth Local Plan.

Condition : 12 - Notwithstanding any materials specified in the application, details and samples of materials proposed to be used (including, but not limited to) for:
a)	the play features, exercise equipment, picnic benches, hammocks and seating proposed for Downshire Field
b)	the play features, picnic benches, loungers, canopy structures and seating proposed for Alton Activity Centre
c)	the surface treatment for the play area including the public realm and the path network for Downshire Field
d)	the surface treatment for the play area including the public realm for the Alton Activity Centre
e)	the boundary treatment (including gates) for Downshire Field
f)	the boundary treatment (including gates) for the Alton Activity Centre
These details shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before the installation of these materials on the relevant part of the development. Such details and samples should be in accordance with the design approach as set out in the Design and Access Statement.
The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved materials and shall be retained, managed maintained as approved thereafter unless otherwise approved in writing by the local planning authority.
Reason: In order to assess the suitability of the proposed materials in the interests of the appearance of the locality in accordance with the NPPF, London Plan policies D4 and HC1 and policies LP1, LP2 and LP3 of the Wandsworth Local Plan.

Condition : 14 - Prior to installation, details including levels of illumination, position, structure, direction and duration of illumination of the proposed external lighting associated with: -
a)	Downshire Field including the uplighters for the Bull Sculpture 
b)	Downshire Field play space, and
c)	The Alton Activity Centre play space
shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. 
The development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details, unless otherwise approved in writing by the local planning authority and the external lighting shall be retained, managed maintained as approved thereafter.
Reason: In the interests of the appearance of the development and the amenity of neighbouring properties in accordance with the NPPF, London Plan policies D4 and HC1 and policies LP1, LP2 and LP3 of the Wandsworth Local Plan.

Condition : 15 - Prior to the use of the play areas in Downshire Field and the Alton Activity Centre, a post-construction circular economy monitoring report for the relevant part of the development shall be completed and be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority. This report shall be in line with the GLA's Circular Economy Statement Guidance and in accordance with the sustainability approach as set out in the Sustainability Statement accompanying this submission.
Reason: In the interests of sustainable waste management and in order to maximise the re-use of materials in accordance with London Plan policy SI7 and Wandsworth Local Plan policy LP13.

Condition : 16 - The development shall be built in accordance with the Flood Risk Assessment and the Drainage Strategy dated March 2024 produced by Campbell Reith which accompanies this planning application.
Reason: To ensure that the development is in accordance with Council policy DMS5, London Plan policy SI12 and the Flood and Water Management Act 2010 and Wandsworth Local Plan policy LP10 and LP12.

Condition : 17 - Prior to the commencement of the relevant part of the development, details of the sustainable drainage features as set out in the Flood Risk Assessment and the Drainage Strategy dated March 2024, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The submitted details shall:
a)	provide information about the measures taken to prevent pollution of the receiving groundwater and/or surface waters;
b)	include a timetable for its implementation; and
c)	provide a management and maintenance plan for the lifetime of the development including any other arrangements to secure the operation of the scheme throughout the lifetime of the development. 
The sustainable drainage features shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details and thereafter be retained and maintained for the lifetime of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.
Reason: To ensure that the development is in accordance with London Plan policy SI12 and SI13 and Wandsworth Local Plan policy LP10 and LP12.

Condition : 18 - Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, details/specification of the cycle stands proposed shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority for:
a)	Downshire Field
b)	The Alton Activity Centre
These approved cycle stands shall be provided prior to the use of the relevant play spaces at Downshire Field and the Alton Activity Centre and shall be permanently retained thereafter for use at all times and shall not be obstructed. The cycle parking should be designed in accordance with the guidance in Chapter 8 of the London Cycling Design Standards. 
Reason: To ensure adequate provision is made for cycle parking in accordance with the NPPF, policy T5 of the London Plan and policy LP49 of the Wandsworth Local Plan.

Condition : 20 - Prior to the first use of the Alton Activity Centre play space, details of the management, hours of opening and access controls for the secure play space immediately adjacent to the Alton Activity Centre building shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. Prior to the use of the Alton Activity Centre play space, the development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details and the use of this space shall operate thereafter in accordance with these details unless otherwise approved in writing by the local planning authority.
Reason: In the interests of providing a safe environment in the locality in accordance with the NPPF, London Plan policy D11 and policy LP1 of the Wandsworth Local Plan.

Condition : 21 - Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved drawings, prior to the use of the Alton Activity Centre play space, details of the proposed boundary treatment and gates separating a secure play space immediately adjacent to the Alton Activity Centre building shall be submitted and approved by the local planning authority. Prior to the use of the Alton Activity Centre play space, the development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and the boundary treatment shall be retained thereafter unless otherwise approved in writing by the local planning authority.
Reason: In the interests of providing a safe environment in the locality in accordance with the NPPF, London Plan policy D11 and policy LP1 of the Wandsworth Local Plan.

Condition : 22 - All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) used during the course of the development that is within the scope of the Greater London Authority 'Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition' Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) dated July 2014, or any subsequent amendment or guidance, shall comply with the emission requirements therein.
Reason: To manage and prevent further deterioration of existing low quality air across London in accordance with London Plan policy SI1.

Condition : 23 - No construction work shall take place on site except between the hours of 8am to 6pm Mondays to Friday and 8am to 4pm on Saturdays and not at all on Sundays and Public Holidays. 
Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of neighbouring residents and the amenities of the locality in accordance with Local Plan policy LP2.
